review: In the last few days, I think Amazon has finally update the Stick software to allow Windows 8.1 devices to mirror via Miracast.  I was just now able to use my Windows RT tablet and Windows 8.1 laptop to "Project My Screen" to my TV via the Fire TV Stick.  (Charms --> Devices --> Project -->  Add the Fire TV Stick as a device, and let all the drivers load.)  I can send video and audio when I'm on websites, but I'm having trouble sending audio when I'm on apps like Netflix, XBox Video, etc.  I'm poking around to see if there's some setting I need to change.  Still, after months of being disappointed that I couldn't "Project My Screen" to the Fire TV Stick, I'm very encouraged by the new development.

review: We've only been using this for about 3 weeks now, but can tell a huge difference with download speeds.  Netflix hasn't rebuffered the entire time we've used it.  We were using our blu-ray player for netflix for 4 years now and it rebuffers even though we have 15mb per second internet; it was worse during storms.  It's also nice that we can move it to the living room or bed room anytime we want without major setting up.
